conclusion: Analyze properties of ideal gas and changes during Stirling cycle stages.
Stirling cycle consists of two isothermal and two adiabatic processes.
Average kinetic energy of molecules is proportional to temperature.
In isothermal processes, temperature and average kinetic energy remain constant.
Work done in isothermal processes is expressed as \(W = nRT \ln\left(\frac{V_f}{V_i}\right)\).
Average kinetic energy remains the same at points A, B, C, and D for isothermal segments.
Adiabatic process Dâ†’A occurs without heat exchange.
Gas expands adiabatically from D to A, volume increases, pressure decreases.
No heat exchange means internal energy remains constant.
Decrease in temperature implies decrease in average kinetic energy.
Average kinetic energy decreases from state D to state A.
